text: The 1991 Country Music Association Awards, 25th Ceremony, was held on September 28, 1991 at the Grand Ole Opry House, Nashville, Tennessee, and was hosted by CMA Award Winner Reba McEntire. == Winners and Nominees == Winner are in Bold. {| class="wikitable" ! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Entertainer of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Album of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Garth Brooks ** Clint Black ** Vince Gill ** Reba McEntire ** George Strait | valign="top" | * No Fences - Garth Brooks ** Don't Rock the Jukebox - Alan Jackson ** Pocket Full of Gold - Vince Gill ** Put Yourself in My Shoes - Clint Black ** Rumor Has It - Reba McEntire |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Male Vocalist of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Female Vocalist of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Vince Gill ** Clint Black ** Garth Brooks ** Alan Jackson ** George Strait | valign="top" | * Tanya Tucker ** Patty Loveless ** Kathy Mattea ** Reba McEntire ** Lorrie Morgan |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Vocal Group of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Vocal Duo of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Kentucky HeadHunters ** Alabama ** Diamond Rio ** Restless Heart ** Shenandoah | valign="top" | * The Judds ** Baillie & The Boys ** Bellamy Brothers ** Foster & Lloyd ** Sweetheart of the Rodeo |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Single of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Song of the Year |- | valign="top" | * "Friends In Low Places" - Garth Brooks ** "Don't Rock the Jukebox" - Alan Jackson ** "Don't Tell Me What to Do" - Pam Tillis ** "Here's a Quarter (Call Someone Who Cares)" - Travis Tritt ** "Pocket Full of Gold" - Vince Gill | valign="top" | * "When I Call Your Name" - Vince Gill and Tim DuBois ** "Don't Rock The Jukebox" - Alan Jackson, Keith Stegall, and Roger Murrah ** "Friends In Low Places" - Dewayne Blackwell and Earl Bud Lee ** "Here in The Real World" - Alan Jackson and Mark Irwin ** "The Dance" - Tony Arata |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Horizon Award ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Musician of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Travis Tritt ** Mary Chapin Carpenter ** Mark Chesnutt ** Doug Stone ** Pam Tillis | valign="top" | * Mark O'Connor ** Chet Atkins ** Barry Beckett ** Paul Franklin ** Matt Rollings |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Music Video of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Vocal Event of the Year |- | valign="top" | * The Thunder Rolls - Garth Brooks ** Come Next Monday - K.T. Oslin ** Don't Rock the Jukebox - Alan Jackson ** Fancy - Reba McEntire ** Love Can Build A Bridge - The Judds | valign="top" | * Mark O'Connor & The New Nashville Cats (feat. Vince Gill, Ricky Skaggs, and Steve Wariner) ** Chet Atkins and Mark Knopfler ** Dolly Parton and Ricky Van Shelton ** Highwaymen - Willie Nelson, Kris Kristofferson, Johnny Cash and Waylon Jennings ** Randy Travis and George Jones |} == Hall of Fame == {| class="wikitable" ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Country Music Hall of Fame Inductees |- | valign="top" | * Boudleaux and Felice Bryant |} == References == Category:Country music awards Country Music Association Category:American country music CMA Country Music Association Awards Category:Country Music Association Awards Category:September 1991 events in the United States
title: 1991 Country Music Association Awards
